Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a variety of habitats, such as land habitats like playgrounds, gardens, forests, and parking lots, as well as water habitats like ponds, streams, and lakes.
The student can illustrate different types of living things (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, clams) found in each habitat.
The student can use their drawing to show patterns of how different types of plants and animals live in different places on land and in water.
The student can include observations based on data from firsthand experiences or media in their drawings to make comparisons between different habitats.
The student can organize and clearly label their drawings to show the diversity of life within each habitat setting.
